II.i.2.C.6.e
.
Handling Undeliverable Essential Mail Upon Identification of a New Address– EP Is Still Pending
When a new address is obtained for undeliverable essential mail, using the guidance in
M21-1, Part II, Subpart i, 2.C.6.d
, and the related EP is
still
pending
the IPC
updates the address using the guidance in
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 3.B.1
associates the undeliverable mail with the claims folder
manages evidence in VBMS (if applicable), and
updates corresponding suspense dates or adds a tracked item appropriate for the type of essential mail being handled to ensure timely action by a claims processor, and
the assigned claims processor
closes related tracked items
generates new letter(s) with correct address
creates new tracked items(s)
resends the letter(s) to the claimant via centralized printing, and
updates corresponding suspense dates, when necessary.
Notes
:
Do not upload FTI directly into the VBMS documents folder.  FTI is stored in a restricted FTI repository outside of VBMS.
When a prior partial rating decision was completed but deferred items resulted in the EP being continued at authorization and the notification letter for the partial rating is returned, follow the procedures at
M21-1, Part II, Subpart i, 2.C.6.f
to update the address and return the notification letter
except
that EP 400 will not be established or cleared nor will a tracked item be necessary.
References
:  For more information on
logging the movement of FTI, see
M21-1, Part XIV, 4.B.2.j
safeguarding FTI, see
M21-1, Part XIV, 4.B
handling returned mail notifying the Veteran of a scheduled VA examination, see
M21-1, Part IV, Subpart i, 2.F.1.c
tracked items, see
M21-4, Appendix D
, and
establishing a diary when resending
VA Form 21P-0537, Marital Status Questionnaire
, or
VA Form 21-0538, Mandatory Verification of Dependents
, to the proper address, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 1.B.5.a
.
